content: I was just investigating https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/89080 and some other similar looking cases while migrating the compiler to 2021, and it looks like rustc_insignificant_dtor was never applied to any standard library types?
It seemed like a core part of our migration story that types we know to be insignificant wouldn't cause spurious migrations for users
I do feel like I recall seeing some discussion about this
Argh, good catch @simulacrum. I too thought we had landed this.
But I remember now that we never did.
